title: News Stories Distribution
question_text: A TV broadcaster is deciding on news stories for the 10 PM evening news. The network strives to make sure that stories cover an equal representation of four news topics: education, crime/police activity, community, and national news. Over the last year, the network covered a total of $980\text{ stories}$ , $204$ of which focused on national news. Utilizing sample proportions, is this statistically significant evidence that the network covered fewer national news stories than it should have last year?

choices.text: No, the sample is too small to make any conclusions.
Yes, since the result of 204 204 out of 980 980 is more than three standard deviations away from the mean.
No, since 204 980 = 20.8 % 204 980 = 20.8 % , which is within 5 % 5 % of the targeted goal.
Unable to tell as conditions are not met.
